com.avaya.csta.physical

Class LampModeConstants

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.avaya.csta.physical.LampModeConstants

  • public class LampModeConstants
extends java.lang.Object
    A type-safe enumeration for Lamp Modes. These constants represent the various modes or states that a lamp can be in, including what color the lamp is, such as red or green, and how the lamp is lit, such as off, steady, winking, etc.

    Lamp modes are used in these methods:

    • PhysicalDeviceListener.lampUpdated() is given the LampModeEvent parameter containing the ID of a lamp whose mode has changed and information about that lamp. Compare LampModeEvent.getlampMode() and LampModeEvent.getLampColor() to LampModeConstants.
    • PhysicalDeviceServices.getLampMode() returns the lamp mode and color of the specified lamp(s) on the specified device. Compare LampModeItem.getLampMode() and LampModeItem.getLampColor() to LampModeConstants.
    The color returned from getLampColor() can be compared to the LampModeConstants: RED and GREEN. The mode returned from getLampMode() can be compared to the other LampModeConstants.

    Here is an example of how you could use LampModeConstants: 

     // Determine if the LampModeEvent is indicating that a lamp is flashing.
 if(LampModeConstants.FLASH.equals(lampModeEvent.getLampMode()))
 {
    System.out.println("Lamp " + lampModeEvent.getLamp() + " is now flashing.");
 }
    Version:
    $Revision: 1.2 $
    Author:
    AVAYA, Inc.
